data.Description: If you are an entrepreneur, God has a purpose and a plan for all those entrepreneurial dreams and creative gifts he gave you. The work you do today—the company you’ve built, the employees you work with, the customers you serve, the shareholders you report to, all of it—serves as an active part of what God wants to accomplish on earth. Building faith-driven businesses are not only a powerful and energizing way to fulfill one’s own creative calling but one of the primary ways God is moving to shape the faith of the next generation.
data.Description_HTML: If you are an entrepreneur, God has a purpose and a plan for all those entrepreneurial dreams and creative gifts he gave you. Building faith-driven businesses are not only a powerful and energizing way to fulfill one’s own creative calling but one of the primary ways God is moving to shape the faith of the next generation.

data.Description: We are excited to now be offering Musikgarten tuition-free at PCPC for our 0–4-year-olds! The only costs related to this course will be for materials. Space is limited, so once a course fills up, a waiting list will form. Please note that the courses for babies and toddlers require a caregiver to be present with their child at all times. The preschool music course asks that caregivers join their child for the last 10 minutes of each class. Please contact Katie at katie.haring@pcpc.org or 214-224-2636 with any questions or concerns.

data.Description: Sexual Sanity Groups assist men in their journey to experience deepening integrity and healing in areas of sexual brokenness. The program is completed in 15 weeks and a 15-week commitment is required to participate. The curriculum utilized is Sexual Sanity for Men by David White, published by Harvest USA. Groups are led and facilitated by previous program graduates and focus on the range of sexual brokenness that crosses all of our lives.  Participants can purchase the Sexual Sanity for Men book at the PCPC Bookstore or on Amazon.

data.Description: Tuesdays, 9:30-11:30 AM | Room 8. SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NEW FOR THE SPRING. Precept Upon Precept A.M. and P.M. are the same inductive Bible study, showing you how to discover God’s truth for yourself, allowing students to become intimately involved with the Scriptures while applying them personally. We have a wonderful time of discussion and learning all together each week. Come be a part of Precepts with us! Childcare is available, link to register at pcpc.org/women.

data.Description: Tuesdays, 9:50-11:30 AM | Room 9, Lower Level. SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NEW IN THE SPRING. A Mother’s Heart seeks to grow and nurture our community of mothers of young children through rich Bible study and intimate small group times. With the desire to develop hearts of wisdom, seasoned mothers seek to encourage and equip them with Christ’s truth during this wonderful and challenging time of parenting young children. Your books are included in the cost of registration. Childcare is available at pcpc.org/women.

data.Description: Wednesdays, 9:30-11:30 AM | Room 9, Lower Level. SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NEW IN THE SPRING. Wednesday Watchmen is a community of women of all ages—young mothers, singles, great-grandmothers, and mid-lifers. Our mornings together have worshipful singing, teaching, and small groups. The small groups discuss the week’s Scripture homework and pray together. The weeks alternate between watching a DVD and Becky teaching. Your book is included in the cost of registration. Childcare is available at pcpc.org/women.

data.Description: Are you seeking help and healing for the hurt of separation or divorce? DivorceCare is a ministry that works to help those affected by divorce or separation to face the challenges and move towards rebuilding life. Here is where you’ll find caring people who understand the issues, begin the healing process, and receive God’s comfort and support. Join our weekly support group led by Patty Moody. Materials are $25 (scholarships available). The course is open to the community and covers topics such as "The Road to Recovery," "Grief and Depression," and "Financial and Legal Issues." Don’t try to go through divorce or separation alone.

data.Description: Re|engage is a marriage enrichment program. Marriages in any condition can benefit, whether you are struggling to get along, your marriage is broken, or you simply want to grow closer as a couple. We will examine God’s design for marriage and apply principles from the Bible to guide couples towards growth in their relationship with each God and each other. You can expect to receive encouragement by hearing stories from other couples that have experienced victory in the midst of hard times. You will also be placed in a small group with a facilitator couple and other couples to work through a 16-lesson curriculum.

data.Meeting_Instructions: Please note that this registration should only be completed one time per couple.

data.Description: Wednesdays, 7:00-8:30 PM | Oak Lawn West Meeting Room. SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NEW IN THE SPRING. If you are in your 20s or 30s, married or single, and looking for a way to study the Bible and meet other women your age, we would love for you to join us. We begin with teaching and then break out into small groups for discussion and prayer. The small groups help us form deeper relationships, find support and accountability, and pray for one another as we seek to apply God’s truth to our lives. The cost of your book is included in registration.

The cost of your book is included in registration.

data.Description: Thursdays, 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM | Room 9. SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NEW  IN THE SPRING. Join women of all ages and stages as we take an in-depth look into a book of the Bible. Come join us as we are instructed and encouraged by God’s Word. Small groups discuss answers to each week’s study, focusing on applying the scripture for that week. After the small groups, the women meet for teaching time together. Your book is included in the cost of registration. Childcare is available for this study at pcpc.org/women.

data.Description: Volunteer to help pack 100,000 meals for children in Zambia! Two shifts are available on Saturday morning, 9:00-11:00 a.m. and 10:30 a.m.-12:30 p.m. You may also choose to work both shifts if your schedule allows. Event is open to all, including families. Please note that childcare is not provided.

Please note that childcare is not provided.

data.Description:
Join City Missions partner OurCalling for a discussion on the state of homelessness in Dallas! As the number of homeless residents has increased over the past couple of years, OurCalling has played a key role in caring for the unsheltered during COVID-19 and collaborated with other agencies to open the Kay Bailey Hutchison Convention Center during recent winter storms.

You can expect to learn about resources that will be helpful as you interact with unsheltered neighbors across the city, how to engage with others in a way that redirects toward resources, and how OurCalling can be helpful in process.

Lunch will be provided and registration is suggested. Contact Jenna Tenpenny for more information.

Your books are included in the cost of registration. Childcare is available at pcpc.org/women.

A Mother’s Heart seeks to grow and nurture our community of mothers of young children through rich Bible study and intimate small group times. With the desire to develop hearts of wisdom, seasoned mothers seek to encourage and equip them with Christ’s truth during this wonderful and challenging time of parenting young children. Your books are included in the cost of registration. Childcare is available at pcpc.org/women.

data.Description: Tuesdays, 6:30-8:30 PM | PCPC Conference Room. SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NEW FOR THE SPRING. Precept Upon Precept A.M. and P.M. are the same inductive Bible study, showing you how to discover God’s truth for yourself, allowing students to become intimately involved with the Scriptures while applying them personally. We have a wonderful time of discussion and learning all together each week. Come be a part of Precepts with us! Childcare is not available for this study.

data.Description: The Bridge is a gathering for women of all ages to hear the story of a PCPC woman. Join us on April 26 as we hear from Lori Turpin, at 6:30 PM in the Grand Hall. We can't wait to be together with you and hear how the Lord is at work in Lori's life. A light dinner will be served so please bring $5 cash or check. No RSVP required.

data.Description: Wednesdays, 9:30-11:30 AM | Room 9, Lower Level. SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NEW IN THE SPRING. Wednesday Watchmen is a community of women of all ages—young mothers, singles, great-grandmothers, and mid-lifers. Our mornings together have worshipful singing, teaching, and small groups. The small groups discuss the week’s Scripture homework and pray together. The weeks alternate between watching a DVD and Becky teaching. Your book is included in the cost of registration. Childcare is available at pcpc.org/women.

data.Description: Re|engage is a marriage enrichment program. Marriages in any condition can benefit, whether you are struggling to get along, your marriage is broken, or you simply want to grow closer as a couple. We will examine God’s design for marriage and apply principles from the Bible to guide couples towards growth in their relationship with each God and each other. You can expect to receive encouragement by hearing stories from other couples that have experienced victory in the midst of hard times. You will also be placed in a small group with a facilitator couple and other couples to work through a 16-lesson curriculum.

You can expect to receive encouragement by hearing stories from other couples that have experienced victory in the midst of hard times. You will also be placed in a small group with a facilitator couple and other couples to work through a 16-lesson curriculum.

data.Description: Wednesdays, 7:00-8:30 PM | Oak Lawn West Meeting Room. SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NEW IN THE SPRING. If you are in your 20s or 30s, married or single, and looking for a way to study the Bible and meet other women your age, we would love for you to join us. We begin with teaching and then break out into small groups for discussion and prayer. The small groups help us form deeper relationships, find support and accountability, and pray for one another as we seek to apply God’s truth to our lives. The cost of your book is included in registration.

data.Description: Sexual Sanity Groups assist men in their journey to experience deepening integrity and healing in areas of sexual brokenness. The program is completed in 15 weeks and a 15-week commitment is required to participate. The curriculum utilized is Sexual Sanity for Men by David White, published by Harvest USA. Groups are led and facilitated by previous program graduates and focus on the range of sexual brokenness that crosses all of our lives.  Participants can purchase the Sexual Sanity for Men book at the PCPC Bookstore or on Amazon.

data.Description: Thursdays, 10:00 AM - 12:00 PM | Room 9. SIGN UP IF YOU ARE NEW  IN THE SPRING. Join women of all ages and stages as we take an in-depth look into a book of the Bible. Come join us as we are instructed and encouraged by God’s Word. Small groups discuss answers to each week’s study, focusing on applying the scripture for that week. After the small groups, the women meet for teaching time together. Your book is included in the cost of registration. Childcare is available for this study at pcpc.org/women.

After the small groups, the women meet for teaching time together. Your book is included in the cost of registration. Childcare is available for this study at pcpc.org/women.

data.Description: Journey back 500 years to attend a Renaissance banquet, delighting your senses with feasting and celebration. This festive evening will be hosted by the Master of the Revels and a troupe of musicians and costumed entertainers. Dinner tickets are $20 and are available beginning April 1 at 10:00 a.m.

data.Description: We are excited to now be offering Musikgarten tuition-free at PCPC for our 0–4-year-olds! The only costs related to this course will be for materials. Space is limited, so once a course fills up, a waiting list will form. Please note that the courses for babies and toddlers require a caregiver to be present with their child at all times. The preschool music course asks that caregivers join their child for the last 10 minutes of each class. Please contact Katie at katie.haring@pcpc.org or 214-224-2636 with any questions or concerns.

data.Description: Early Morning Bible Study, 7-8:15 a.m., Room 9. How many times have you left a conversation or a family discussion and thought, “I shouldn’t have said that!” And often we feel we don’t have words for someone facing tragedy—or we are silent when we have opportunity to speak about salvation in Jesus. True transformation of our “talk” is more than learning to be diplomatic and “nice.” Jesus said, “For out of the abundance of the heart the mouth speaks.” (Matthew 12:34) Our redemption brings renewal from the inside out—different attitudes and words because we are different in Him. Join us for teaching and talking about this transformation as we look at several passages of God’s Word together!
